qas.question: Who went to the Fergana Valley to restore order?
Where is the Fergana Valley located?
Who were targeted by the local Uzbeks?
Who was fired from First Secretary position by Gorbachev?

context: Thousands of <a0_0>Soviet troops<a0_0/> were sent to the Fergana Valley, <a1_0>southeast of the Uzbek capital<a1_0/> Tashkent, to re-establish order after clashes in which local Uzbeks hunted down <a2_0>members of the Meskhetian minority<a2_0/> in several days of rioting between June 4–11, 1989; about 100 people were killed. On June 23, 1989, Gorbachev removed <a3_0>Rafiq Nishonov<a3_0/> as First Secretary of the Communist Party of the Uzbek SSR and replaced him with <a4_0>Karimov<a4_0/>, who went on to lead Uzbekistan as a Soviet Republic and subsequently as an independent state.
